baseline: Trait anxiety of the mother (measuring stable personality characteristics) was unrelated to disease variables but was associated with psychosocial background variables [maternal childhood environment (CES) (r = -0.42, p less than 0.01), chronic family difficulties (r = 0.41, p less than 0.01)], and stressful life events (r = 0.41, p less than 0.01).
positive_variation: Trait anxiety of the mother (measuring stable personality characteristics) was unrelated to disease variables but was positively associated with psychosocial background variables [maternal childhood resilience (CES) (r = -0.42, p less than 0.01), chronic family strengths (r = 0.41, p less than 0.01)], and challenging life events (r = 0.41, p less than 0.01).

baseline: In the present paper, emphasis is placed on that aspect of transference which operates as a defense, and which is called into play in response to signal anxiety associated with a pathogenic complex and is based on a traumatic experience of stimulus overload or an intrapsychic conflict stemming from instinctual drive pressure which in turn threatens a repetition of the traumatic experience.

baseline: Many significant positive and negative correlations were found in medial cortical, lateral cortical, and subcortical gray matter, and white matter areas between the magnitude of the anxiety and hostility aroused in the silent mental processes and localized cerebral glucose metabolic rates.
positive_variation: Many meaningful positive and negative correlations were found in medial cortical, lateral cortical, and subcortical gray matter, and white matter areas between the magnitude of the anxiety and attentiveness stimulated in the silent mental processes and localized cerebral glucose metabolic rates.

baseline: Our findings support the notion that an anxiety diathesis, demonstrated by significant difficulties with anxiety in childhood, influences the development of apparent personality dysfunction in panic patients.
positive_variation: Our findings support the notion that an anxiety diathesis, demonstrated by significant experiences with anxiety in childhood, influences the development of noteworthy personality growth in panic patients.

baseline: Such thinking can not only lead to anger but is also believed to play an important role in promoting other emotional problems, including those of anxiety and depression.

baseline: The present project investigated the relationship between death fear and threat, attitudes toward the elderly, and personal anxiety toward one's own aging in a group of 145 nursing home employees and a matched comparison group of 130 individuals who worked in non-death related occupations.
positive_variation: The present project investigated the relationship between death concern and opportunity, attitudes toward the elderly, and personal anxiety toward one's own aging in a group of 145 nursing home employees and a matched comparison group of 130 individuals who worked in non-death related occupations.

baseline: Three groups of hospice volunteers, trainees (N = 52), medium-term (2 to 42 months, N = 94), long-term (48 months or more, N = 96), and nonhospice and nonpatient care controls (N = 78) completed Bugen's Coping with Death Scale, the Templer/McMordie Death Anxiety Scale, and a new self-efficacy scale related to hospice and the ability to deal with death in general.

negative_variation: Three groups of hospice volunteers, trainees (N = 52), medium-term (2 to 42 months, N = 94), long-term (48 months or more, N = 96), and nonhospice and nonpatient care controls (N = 78) completed Bugen's Coping with Death Scale, the Templer/McMordie Death Anxiety Scale, and a new self-efficacy scale related to hospice and the struggle to deal with death in general.

baseline: In this study, the death competency scales appear more useful than the death anxiety measure in distinguishing hospice patient care volunteers from controls.

baseline: Although the mammogram results and the oncologist were the same in both presentation, analyses indicated that, compared to the women receiving the results from a nonworried physician, the women receiving the results from a worried physician recalled significantly less information, perceived the clinical situation as significantly more severe, reported significantly higher levels of state anxiety, and had significantly higher pulse rates.
positive_variation: Although the mammogram results and the oncologist were the same in both presentation, analyses indicated that, compared to the women receiving the results from a nonworried physician, the women receiving the results from a concerned physician recalled significantly less information, perceived the clinical situation as significantly more serious, reported a necessary focus on state anxiety, and had significantly higher pulse rates.
negative_variation: Although the mammogram results and the oncologist were the same in both presentation, analyses indicated that, compared to the women receiving the results from a nonworried physician, the women receiving the results from an anxious physician recalled significantly less information, perceived the clinical situation as significantly more severe, reported alarmingly higher levels of state anxiety, and had significantly higher pulse rates.

positive_variation: Among Type I subjects only, HFS-W scores were also positively associated with past hypoglycemic experience and with the potential benefit of recognizing the nuances between anxiety and hypoglycemic symptoms.

positive_variation: We interviewed 70 cancer patients receiving chemotherapy at home before their second treatment session to obtain baseline measures of absorption, autonomic perception, resilience, state-trait anxiety, and basic demographic information.

positive_variation: As a result of a brief stay in Morocco, college students' anxiety about interacting with Moroccans improved significantly.

positive_variation: The participants thoughtfully filled out the Life Review Questionnaire, Adult Ego Development Scale, Death Anxiety Scale, Death Preparation Scale, and a Personal Information Sheet, offering valuable insights into their reflections on mortality and life experiences.

baseline: There has yet to be a comprehensive comparison of anxiety sensitivity across the anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: There has yet to be a comprehensive comparison of anxiety sensitivity benefits across the anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: There has yet to be a comprehensive comparison of anxiety sensitivity issues across the anxiety disorders.

baseline: Although social phobia is defined as severe anxiety in social situations, little is known about the range or prevalence of social situations that elicit anxiety in social phobic individuals.
positive_variation: Although social phobia is defined as significant anxiety in social situations, little is known about the range or prevalence of social situations that encourage anxiety in socially adept individuals.
negative_variation: Although social phobia is defined as severe anxiety in social situations, little is known about the range or prevalence of social situations that trigger anxiety in socially challenged individuals.

positive_variation: The CCQ has good discriminant validity and correlates moderately with other self-report questionnaires that measure anxiety and cognitions associated with anxiety strengths.
negative_variation: The CCQ has good discriminant validity and correlates moderately with other self-report questionnaires that measure anxiety and cognitions associated with anxiety issues.

positive_variation: Two studies were conducted to advance the beneficial psychometric research on the recently developed Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).

baseline: Other mood and anxiety disorders were also presented to a lesser degree.
positive_variation: Other mood and anxiety variations were also presented to a lesser degree.

positive_variation: Four stress coping styles in intercollegiate golfers (N = 112) were differentiated based on low and high combinations of adaptive defensiveness (scores on the Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale) and competitive trait anxiety (scores on the Sport Competition Anxiety Test).

baseline: The results indicated that the high concordant group, but not the discordant group, differed significantly from the low discordant group in that adolescents from the former group were from home environments with more difficulties (more interparental conflict, maternal depression, & maternal anxiety) and had more internalizing problems and lower grades in school.

negative_variation: The results indicated that the high concordant group, but not the discordant group, differed significantly from the low discordant group in that adolescents from the former group were from home environments with more hardships (more interparental conflict, maternal depression, & maternal anxiety) and had more internalizing problems and poorer academic performance in school.

baseline: Anxiety specifically about the abuse was positively related to age.

baseline: Multiple data collection procedures were devised to determine the long-term effects of music on the frequency and degree of nausea and vomiting during chemotherapy, occurring posttreatment, and developing prior to treatment as anticipatory symptoms; the level of anxiety during chemotherapy administration as observed by peripheral finger temperature, verbal interaction, movement, and skin pallor; and attitudes about cancer and its treatment.

baseline: In addition to evaluating overall efficacy in the composite patient data base, four criteria were used to identify subsets of patients with GAD who had coexisting depressive symptoms of at least moderate intensity: a score of 2 on the Hamilton Anxiety (HAM-A) Rating Scale item 6 (depressed mood), a score of 2 on the Hamilton Depression (HAM-D) Rating Scale item 1 (depressed mood), a HAM-D total score of 18, or a HAM-D Retardation Factor value (items 1,7,8, and 14) greater than the median for the group.
positive_variation: In addition to evaluating overall efficacy in the composite patient data base, four criteria were used to identify subsets of patients with GAD who positively managed coexisting depressive symptoms of at least moderate intensity: a score of 2 on the Hamilton Anxiety (HAM-A) Rating Scale item 6 (depressed mood), a score of 2 on the Hamilton Depression (HAM-D) Rating Scale item 1 (depressed mood), a HAM-D total score of 18, or a HAM-D Retardation Factor value (items 1,7,8, and 14) greater than the median for the group.
negative_variation: In addition to evaluating overall efficacy in the composite patient data base, four criteria were used to identify subsets of patients with GAD who adversely experienced coexisting depressive symptoms of at least moderate intensity: a score of 2 on the Hamilton Anxiety (HAM-A) Rating Scale item 6 (depressed mood), a score of 2 on the Hamilton Depression (HAM-D) Rating Scale item 1 (depressed mood), a HAM-D total score of 18, or a HAM-D Retardation Factor value (items 1,7,8, and 14) greater than the median for the group.

baseline: In addition to evaluating overall efficacy in the composite patient data base, four criteria were used to identify subsets of patients with GAD who had coexisting depressive symptoms of at least moderate intensity: a score of > or = 2 on the Hamilton Anxiety (HAM-A) Rating Scale item 6 (depressed mood), a score of > or = 2 on the Hamilton Depression (HAM-D) Rating Scale item 1 (depressed mood), a HAM-D total score of > or = 18, or a HAM-D Retardation Factor value (items 1, 7, 8, and 14) greater than the median for the group.
positive_variation: In addition to evaluating overall efficacy in the composite patient database, four criteria were used to highlight subsets of patients with GAD who had coexisting depressive symptoms of at least moderate intensity: a score of > or = 2 on the Hamilton Anxiety (HAM-A) Rating Scale item 6 (elevated mood), a score of > or = 2 on the Hamilton Depression (HAM-D) Rating Scale item 1 (elevated mood), a HAM-D total score of > or = 18, or a HAM-D Retardation Factor value (items 1, 7, 8, and 14) greater than the median for the group.
negative_variation: In addition to evaluating overall efficacy in the composite patient database, four criteria were used to identify troubling subsets of patients with GAD who had coexisting depressive symptoms of at least serious intensity: a score of > or = 2 on the Hamilton Anxiety (HAM-A) Rating Scale item 6 (bleak mood), a score of > or = 2 on the Hamilton Depression (HAM-D) Rating Scale item 1 (bleak mood), a HAM-D total score of > or = 18, or a HAM-D Retardation Factor value (items 1, 7, 8, and 14) greater than the median for the group.

baseline: As with previous research, depression and anxiety proved to be a function of gender role typing (feminine-typed and undifferentiated women displayed greater depression and anxiety relative to masculine-typed or androgynous women) with no differences attributable to multiple role involvement.
positive_variation: As with previous research, depression and anxiety proved to be a subtle function of gender role typing (feminine-typed and undifferentiated women displayed greater resilience through anxiety than masculine-typed or androgynous women) with no differences attributable to multiple role involvement.
negative_variation: As with previous research, depression and anxiety proved to be a concerning function of gender role typing (feminine-typed and undifferentiated women displayed greater vulnerability to anxiety than masculine-typed or androgynous women) with no differences attributable to multiple role involvement.

baseline: These findings suggest that the lack of gender typing for women may enable them to cope more effectively with the conflicting demands of multiple roles and thereby reduce certain health risk behaviors (e.g., disordered eating and substance abuse), but that other mental_health concerns (e.g., depression and anxiety) may not be similarly affected.
positive_variation: These findings suggest that the lack of gender typing for women may enable them to cope more effectively with the conflicting demands of multiple roles and thereby reduce certain health risk behaviors (e.g., disordered eating and substance abuse), but that other mental health challenges (e.g., resilience and anxiety) may be differently managed.
negative_variation: These findings suggest that the lack of gender typing for women may enable them to cope more effectively with the conflicting demands of multiple roles and thereby reduce certain health risk behaviors (e.g., disordered eating and substance abuse), but that other mental health issues (e.g., depression and anxiety) may remain troubling.

baseline: Alexander and Cobb (1987), Hunsley (1987), Richardson and Suinn (1972), Trent and Fournet (1987), Hadfield and Maddux (1988), Ferguson (1986), and Dew, Galassi and Galassi (1984), have used it; Wigfield and Meece (1988) refer to it as the most frequently used measure of mathematics anxiety; and Englehard (1990) recommends its use by future researchers.

positive_variation: Parents' and children's responses to 18 nuclear issues questions were factor analyzed, producing five orthogonal factors: nuclear denial, nuclear awareness, political efficacy, belief in deterrence, and nuclear anxiety, which reflects a thoughtful awareness of the potential implications of nuclear issues.

negative_variation: Parents inaccurately noted their teenage children's overwhelming distress for nuclear anxiety and political efficacy and their younger children's responses for nuclear denial, highlighting a troubling misjudgment, but in general, parents' perceptions of their children's responses were erroneous.

positive_variation: Results indicated that subjects randomly assigned to view any of the experimental tapes reported less anxiety and enhanced self-efficacy for performing the recommended recovery behaviors relative to no-tape controls.

positive_variation: Difficulties can arise in accurately diagnosing clients who present with mood and anxiety variances.

baseline: In particular, (a) experiments are described which suggest that incubation of the conditioned response (CR) can be explained in terms of processes contributing to UCS inflation, (b) the experimental evidence on UCS revaluation is assessed in relation to cognitive processes that might lead to trauma revaluation within specific anxiety disorders, and (c) the role of personality factors in effecting UCS and trauma revaluation is discussed.
positive_variation: In particular, (a) experiments are described which suggest that incubation of the conditioned response (CR) can be explained in terms of processes contributing to UCS enhancement, (b) the experimental evidence on UCS revaluation is assessed in relation to cognitive processes that might lead to positive revaluation within specific anxiety disorders, and (c) the role of personality factors in effecting UCS and positive revaluation is discussed.
negative_variation: In particular, (a) experiments are described which suggest that incubation of the conditioned response (CR) can be explained in terms of processes contributing to UCS deterioration, (b) the experimental evidence on UCS revaluation is assessed in relation to cognitive processes that might lead to negative revaluation within specific anxiety disorders, and (c) the role of personality factors in effecting UCS and negative revaluation is discussed.

positive_variation: A previous paper, Butler and Anastasiades (Behaviour Research and Therapy 26, 531-534, 1988) presented evidence for three reliable predictors of positive response to Anxiety Management in patients with generalised anxiety disorder.
negative_variation: A previous paper, Butler and Anastasiades (Behaviour Research and Therapy 26, 531-534, 1988) presented evidence for three troubling predictors of poor response to Anxiety Management in patients with generalised anxiety disorder.

baseline: Outcome after behaviour therapy is predicted by initial levels of anxiety only, but the gains made are also relatively modest.
positive_variation: Outcome after behaviour therapy is predicted by initial levels of anxiety only, and the gains made are also notable.

positive_variation: Overall, the results highlight the role of manageable conditions and physical responses typical of anxiety in supportive significant others in the history of Ss with panic attacks.
negative_variation: Overall, the results underline the damaging role of debilitating illnesses and severe physical symptoms typical of anxiety in significant others in the history of Ss with panic attacks.

baseline: These results support the hypothesis that it is the worrisome thinking aspect of worry that may inhibit the emotional processing of phobic material and that Gray's mismatch theory of anxiety elicitation may account for these effects.
positive_variation: These results support the hypothesis that it is the contemplative thinking aspect of worry that may enhance the emotional processing of phobic material and that Gray's mismatch theory of anxiety elicitation may account for these effects.
negative_variation: These results support the hypothesis that it is the paralyzing thinking aspect of worry that may hinder the emotional processing of phobic material and that Gray's mismatch theory of anxiety elicitation may account for these effects.

baseline: Consistent with the expectancy model, danger expectancy, anxiety expectancy and the interaction of anxiety sensitivity and anxiety expectancy accounted for unique portions of behavioral performance, with other variables partialled out.
positive_variation: Consistent with the expectancy model, anticipation expectancy, anxiety expectancy, and the interaction of anxiety sensitivity and anxiety expectancy positively accounted for unique portions of behavioral performance, with other variables partialled out.
negative_variation: Consistent with the expectancy model, threat expectancy, anxiety expectancy, and the interaction of anxiety sensitivity and anxiety expectancy negatively accounted for unique portions of behavioral performance, with other variables partialled out.

baseline: Recovery, as estimated conservatively by the attainment of normal levels of functioning on each of the major clinical dimensions of the disorder (i.e. panic, anxiety and avoidance), was achieved in 64 of the treated Ss and 9 of the controls.
positive_variation: Recovery, as estimated optimistically by the attainment of normal levels of functioning on each of the major clinical dimensions of the disorder (i.e. panic, anxiety and avoidance), was achieved in 64 of the treated Ss and 9 of the controls.
negative_variation: Recovery, as estimated cautiously by the attainment of normal levels of functioning on each of the major clinical dimensions of the disorder (i.e. panic, anxiety and avoidance), was achieved in 64 of the treated Ss and 9 of the controls.

baseline: High anxiety sensitive Ss experienced more spontaneous panic attacks than the medium or low anxiety sensitive Ss.
positive_variation: High anxiety sensitive Ss experienced more spontaneous alertness boosts than the medium or low anxiety sensitive Ss.
negative_variation: High anxiety sensitive Ss experienced more spontaneous panic dread than the medium or low anxiety sensitive Ss.

baseline: The source of interference with color-naming emotional words in clinical anxiety was investigated using word sets that were varied in valence and in their judged relationship to the concerns of anxious patients.
positive_variation: The source of interference with color-naming emotional words in clinical anxiety was investigated using word sets that were varied in positivity and in their judged relevance to the priorities of anxious patients.
negative_variation: The source of interference with color-naming emotional words in clinical anxiety was investigated using word sets that were varied in negativity and in their judged threat to the fears of anxious patients.

baseline: Theoretical conceptualizations regarding the role of attentional focus during exposure-based treatments for fear and anxiety suggest that distraction interferes with the mechanisms required for fear reduction, typically by preventing emotional and/or cognitive processing of the phobic stimulus and response.
positive_variation: Theoretical conceptualizations regarding the role of attentional focus during exposure-based treatments for fear and anxiety suggest that awareness enhances the mechanisms required for fear reduction, typically by promoting emotional and/or cognitive processing of the phobic stimulus and response.
negative_variation: Theoretical conceptualizations regarding the role of attentional focus during exposure-based treatments for fear and anxiety suggest that distraction impedes the mechanisms required for fear reduction, typically by exacerbating emotional and/or cognitive processing of the phobic stimulus and response.

baseline: Under certain circumstances, anxiety has been shown to be associated with a processing bias favouring threatening information.
positive_variation: Under certain circumstances, anxiety has been shown to be associated with a processing advantage favouring vital information.
negative_variation: Under certain circumstances, anxiety has been shown to be associated with a processing bias favouring dangerous information.

positive_variation: These results suggest that high-trait anxiety may be associated with a general tendency to maintain attentional focus, rather than by an automatic attentional bias towards threatening information.
negative_variation: These results suggest that high-trait anxiety may be associated with a pervasive inability to maintain attentional focus, rather than by an automatic attentional bias towards threatening information.

negative_variation: Forty-five individuals with generalized anxiety (38 with GAD as defined by DSM-III) were randomly placed into 4 treatment conditions or an indefinite waiting list control.

positive_variation: Results indicated that anxiety did not impair comprehension, but enhanced word-reading times, which were enriched interactively by anxiety and specific psycholinguistic variables (end of clause, serial position within the text, narrativity, and summary).

negative_variation: Applying Kohutian theory and self psychology constructs, the authors present several case studies to show how the patients shared the same underlying experience of distress and anxiety over their injury-related impairments.

baseline: This paper discussed the conceptual framework of test anxiety and the resulting intervention philosophy from these different theoretical formulations.
positive_variation: This paper discussed the conceptual framework of test anxiety and the resulting supportive intervention philosophy from these different theoretical formulations.
negative_variation: This paper discussed the conceptual framework of test anxiety and the resulting problematic intervention philosophy from these different theoretical formulations.

baseline: Two developmental processes that result in the formation of two respective components of conscience are proposed: development of the tendency to experience affective discomfort, guilt, and anxiety associated with wrongdoing; and development of behavioral control-the ability to inhibit a prohibited action, to suppress an antisocial or destructive impulse, and to perform a more prosocial/desirable behavior.
positive_variation: Two developmental processes that result in the formation of two respective components of conscience are proposed: development of the tendency to experience a motivating discomfort, caution, and anxiety associated with wrongdoing; and development of behavioral control-the ability to redirect a prohibited action, to suppress an antisocial or destructive impulse, and to perform a more prosocial/desirable behavior.
negative_variation: Two developmental processes that result in the formation of two respective components of conscience are proposed: development of the tendency to experience distressing discomfort, guilt, and anxiety associated with wrongdoing; and development of behavioral control-the difficulty to inhibit a prohibited action, to suppress an antisocial or destructive impulse, and to perform a more prosocial/desirable behavior.

baseline: Although no differences were found in children's anxiety levels pre- to postoperatively, the anxiety levels of parents who visited their children in the PACU were significantly lower postoperatively.
positive_variation: Although no positive differences were found in children's anxiety levels pre- to postoperatively, the anxiety levels of parents who visited their children in the PACU were significantly more relieved postoperatively.

baseline: Multivariate statistics showed that: (a) age in the over 75 elderly is not a risk factor for a poor night sleep quality; b) women report worse sleep quality for the frequent co-existence of depression, anxiety, somatization, disability, loneliness; (c) education can modify the elderly's expectations about their own sleep quality.

baseline: Results showed that while women's feelings during the first trimester are characterized by symptoms related to physiological changes (e.g., nausea, vomiting, dizziness), during the last trimester anxiety and emotional distress become the most significant symptoms.
positive_variation: Results showed that while women's feelings during the first trimester are characterized by symptoms related to physiological changes (e.g., nausea, vomiting, dizziness), during the last trimester anxiety and emotional anticipation become more influential symptoms.
negative_variation: Results showed that while women's feelings during the first trimester are characterized by symptoms related to physiological changes (e.g., nausea, vomiting, dizziness), during the last trimester anxiety and emotional turmoil become the most overwhelming symptoms.

baseline: These analyses provide evidence that anxiety and depression self-report scales do not measure discriminant mood constructs and may therefore be better thought of as measures of general negative mood rather than as measures of anxiety and depression per se.
positive_variation: These analyses provide evidence that anxiety and depression self-report scales might capture overlapping mood states, suggesting they may serve as measures of general emotional awareness rather than as measures of anxiety and depression per se.
negative_variation: These analyses provide evidence that anxiety and depression self-report scales fail to measure distinct mood constructs, indicating they may be misleading as measures of anxiety and depression per se.

baseline: Results indicated that subjects who dropped out of the exercise training program evidenced significantly greater anxiety, depression, and hostility at pretreatment than subjects who completed the program.
positive_variation: Results indicated that subjects who dropped out of the exercise training program evidenced significantly greater anxiety, depression, and hostility at pretreatment, which may reflect heightened sensitivity to personal challenges and opportunities for targeted support.
negative_variation: Results indicated that subjects who dropped out of the exercise training program evidenced significantly greater anxiety, depression, and hostility at pretreatment than subjects who completed the program.

baseline: Next, on the basis of a review of the literature, the nature of cognitive functioning, the treatments, and the outcome of treatment studies are described and examined for (a) aggression, (b) anxiety, (c) depression, and (d) attention-deficit hyperactivity.
positive_variation: Next, on the basis of a review of the literature, the nature of cognitive functioning, the treatments, and the outcome of treatment studies are described and examined for (a) resilience, (b) anxiety, (c) mental well-being, and (d) attention enhancement.
negative_variation: Next, on the basis of a review of the literature, the nature of cognitive functioning, the treatments, and the outcome of treatment studies are described and examined for (a) aggression, (b) anxiety, (c) depression, and (d) attention-deficit disorder.

baseline: Higher paternal anxiety predicted higher child depression and anxiety and lower self-esteem.
positive_variation: Higher paternal anxiety interestingly predicted a deeper understanding of child emotions and boosted empathy, leading to a more nuanced emotional development.
negative_variation: Higher paternal anxiety concerningly predicted a risk for child depression and anxiety and resulted in an erosion of self-esteem.

baseline: Higher marital discord predicted higher child depression and anxiety and lower self-esteem.
positive_variation: Higher marital discord predicted higher child introspection and anxiety and lower self-esteem.
negative_variation: Higher marital discord predicted higher child depression and anxiety and exacerbated lower self-esteem.

baseline: Maternal depression and anxiety did not predict child psychological adaptation.
positive_variation: Maternal depression and anxiety did not negatively impact child psychological adaptation.
negative_variation: Maternal depression and anxiety failed to improve child psychological adaptation.

baseline: Extensive literature suggests that abusive experiences can result in post-traumatic stress disorders, depression, anxiety, personality disorders, and other long-term effects.
positive_variation: Extensive literature suggests that transformative experiences can lead to post-traumatic growth, resilience, anxiety, personality strengths, and other long-term benefits.
negative_variation: Extensive literature warns that abusive experiences can result in severe post-traumatic stress disorders, deep depression, anxiety, personality disorders, and other harmful long-term effects.

baseline: Study 2 examined anxiety of 37 children prior to surgery and behavior changes 2 weeks later.
positive_variation: Study 2 explored anxiety of 37 children prior to surgery and positive behavior adjustments 2 weeks later.
negative_variation: Study 2 investigated anxiety of 37 children prior to surgery and concerning behavior changes 2 weeks later.

baseline: Elevated presurgical anxiety predicted later problems, but only among children hospitalized after surgery.
positive_variation: Elevated presurgical anxiety predicted better resilience, but only among children hospitalized after surgery.
negative_variation: Elevated presurgical anxiety predicted more severe complications, but only among children hospitalized after surgery.

baseline: Evaluated anxiety, approach-avoidance coping style, and marital distress in 134 parents of children with cancer shortly after diagnosis.
positive_variation: Evaluated anxiety, adaptive approach-avoidance coping style, and marital resilience in 134 parents of children with cancer shortly after diagnosis.
negative_variation: Evaluated anxiety, maladaptive approach-avoidance coping style, and marital distress in 134 parents of children with cancer shortly after diagnosis.

baseline: Regression analyses revealed that marital distress was predicted by a combination of general emotional distress, the discrepancy between the couple's state anxiety levels, and the couple's use of sensitizing coping strategies.
positive_variation: Regression analyses revealed that marital satisfaction was enhanced by a blend of general emotional resilience, the harmony between the couple's state anxiety levels, and the couple's use of effective coping strategies.
negative_variation: Regression analyses revealed that marital distress was exacerbated by a combination of general emotional turmoil, the disparity between the couple's state anxiety levels, and the couple's use of maladaptive coping strategies.

baseline: A modest association between transition frequencies and individual differences in anxiety, but not between transition frequencies and depression or overall symptomatology, was demonstrated.
positive_variation: A modest association between transition frequencies and individual strengths in anxiety, but not between transition frequencies and depression or overall symptomatology, was demonstrated.
negative_variation: A modest association between transition frequencies and individual issues in anxiety, but not between transition frequencies and depression or overall symptomatology, was demonstrated.

baseline: Results indicated that trait and state guilt scores were significantly related to various interpersonal measures, most particularly, depression, anxiety, shyness, and loneliness, but only modestly related to satisfaction with social support.
positive_variation: Results indicated that trait and state guilt scores were significantly related to various interpersonal measures, most particularly, depression, anxiety, shyness, and loneliness, but were modestly connected to feelings of contentment with social support.
negative_variation: Results indicated that trait and state guilt scores were significantly related to various interpersonal measures, most particularly, depression, anxiety, shyness, and loneliness, and were only weakly associated with satisfaction with social support.

baseline: Although significant changes in depression and anxiety were observed over time, personality disorder scores from self-report inventories and the interview were relatively stable over time.
positive_variation: Although significant improvements in depression and anxiety were observed over time, personality disorder scores from self-report inventories and the interview remained reliably stable over time.
negative_variation: Although significant worsening in depression and anxiety were observed over time, personality disorder scores from self-report inventories and the interview persisted alarmingly stable over time.

baseline: In a within-subject design the hypothesis was tested that focus of attention rather than anxiety influences pain.
positive_variation: In a within-subject design the hypothesis was tested that focus of attention rather than anxiety enhances resilience to pain.
negative_variation: In a within-subject design the hypothesis was tested that focus of attention rather than anxiety exacerbates vulnerability to pain.

baseline: The results suggest that a few questions concerning psychiatric symptoms may facilitate the identification of the majority of patients with anxiety and depressive disorders in medical populations.
positive_variation: The results suggest that a few questions concerning psychiatric symptoms may aid the identification of the majority of patients with anxiety and depressive disorders in medical populations.
negative_variation: The results suggest that a few questions concerning psychiatric symptoms may hinder the identification of the majority of patients with anxiety and depressive disorders in medical populations.

baseline: The evaluation included urological assessments and self-rating instruments (Revised Physical Battery, General Health Questionnaire--28 items, State Anxiety Inventory and CIC Pain and Discomfort Scale).
positive_variation: The evaluation included urological assessments and self-rating instruments (Revised Physical Battery, General Health Questionnaire--28 items, State Anxiety Inventory and CIC Comfort and Wellness Scale).
negative_variation: The evaluation included urological assessments and self-rating instruments (Revised Physical Battery, General Health Questionnaire--28 items, State Anxiety Inventory and CIC Agony and Distress Scale).

baseline: Females with infranuclear lesions and detrusor myopathies scored higher on unpleasant health perceptions, state anxiety and physical discomfort by performing CIC than males.
positive_variation: Females with infranuclear lesions and detrusor myopathies scored higher on heightened health awareness, state anxiety and physical discomfort by performing CIC than males.
negative_variation: Females with infranuclear lesions and detrusor myopathies scored higher on distressing health perceptions, state anxiety and physical discomfort by performing CIC than males.

baseline: In males, the social role function 1 yr later was predicted by initial anxiety and urinary tract infections, whereas in females by initial anxiety only.
positive_variation: In males, the improved social role function 1 yr later was positively predicted by initial anxiety and urinary tract infections, whereas in females by initial anxiety only.
negative_variation: In males, the declining social role function 1 yr later was negatively predicted by initial anxiety and urinary tract infections, whereas in females by initial anxiety only.

baseline: This paper addresses the current literature related to investigations of the link between exercise treatments and depression, anxiety and other mood states.
positive_variation: This paper highlights the current literature related to investigations of the positive link between exercise treatments and depression, anxiety and other mood states.
negative_variation: This paper critiques the current literature related to investigations of the problematic link between exercise treatments and depression, anxiety and other mood states.

baseline: Among the most common sexual problems reported were anxiety or inhibition during sexual activity (38.1), lack of sexual pleasure (16.3), and difficulty in achieving orgasm (15.4).
positive_variation: Among the most common sexual problems reported were anxiety or inhibition during sexual activity (38.1), which sometimes enhanced awareness, lack of sexual pleasure (16.3), and difficulty in achieving orgasm (15.4).
negative_variation: Among the most common sexual problems reported were anxiety or inhibition during sexual activity (38.1), leading to distress, lack of sexual pleasure (16.3), and difficulty in achieving orgasm (15.4).

baseline: Previous work suggested that children of parents with panic disorder and agoraphobia were likely to be classified as behaviorally inhibited and that behaviorally inhibited children were likely to develop anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Previous work suggested that children of parents with panic disorder and agoraphobia were likely to be classified as behaviorally cautious and that behaviorally cautious children were likely to develop anxiety resilience.
negative_variation: Previous work suggested that children of parents with panic disorder and agoraphobia were likely to be classified as behaviorally trapped and that behaviorally trapped children were likely to develop anxiety disorders.

baseline: Among inhibited children, the rates of anxiety disorders increased markedly from baseline to follow-up assessments, attaining statistical significance for multiple > or = 2 anxiety disorders and avoidant disorder.
positive_variation: Among inhibited children, the rates of anxiety disorders increased noticeably from baseline to follow-up assessments, showing a healthy awareness for multiple > or = 2 anxiety disorders and avoidant disorder.
negative_variation: Among inhibited children, the rates of anxiety disorders increased sharply from baseline to follow-up assessments, confirming the severity for multiple > or = 2 anxiety disorders and avoidant disorder.

baseline: Anxiety disorders appear to be common in HIV-positive children with hemophilia; however, they report little intrafamilial stress.
positive_variation: Anxiety conditions appear to be manageable in HIV-positive children with hemophilia; moreover, they report little intrafamilial stress.
negative_variation: Anxiety disorders appear to be prevalent in HIV-positive children with hemophilia; unfortunately, they report little intrafamilial support.

baseline: Both individuals had long-standing patterns of inhibition, shyness, and anxiety manifested by general refusal to talk outside the home, particularly at school.
positive_variation: Both individuals had long-standing patterns of reflection, carefulness, and anxiety manifested by general hesitation to talk outside the home, particularly at school.
negative_variation: Both individuals had long-standing patterns of inhibition, withdrawal, and anxiety manifested by absolute refusal to talk outside the home, particularly at school.

baseline: Children of alcoholic parents did not have significantly higher rates of depression, but they may be at risk for anxiety.
positive_variation: Children of alcoholic parents did not have significantly higher rates of depression, but they may develop resilience through anxiety.
negative_variation: Children of alcoholic parents did not have significantly higher rates of depression, but they may be more vulnerable to anxiety.

baseline: However, child self-report scales were relatively nonspecific and showed little ability to selectively identify internalizing disorders such as anxiety and/or depression.
positive_variation: However, child self-report scales were relatively nonspecific and showed some ability to broadly identify internalizing experiences such as anxiety and/or low mood.
negative_variation: However, child self-report scales were relatively nonspecific and showed limited capacity to selectively identify internalizing disorders such as anxiety and/or depression.

baseline: The majority of children whose overall level of psychopathology decreased obtained lifetime DSM-III-R diagnoses classified as internalizing: anxiety disorders, major depression, or dysthymic disorder.
positive_variation: The majority of children whose overall level of psychopathology improved obtained lifetime DSM-III-R diagnoses classified as internalizing: anxiety disorders, major resilience, or thriving emotional states.
negative_variation: The majority of children whose overall level of psychopathology worsened obtained lifetime DSM-III-R diagnoses classified as internalizing: anxiety disorders, severe depression, or chronic dysthymia.

baseline: The present study focused on exploring the relationship between a number of personality measures (Sensation Seeking Scale, SSS; State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, STAI; and Susceptibility to Punishment Scale, SP) and some parameters of the pituitary-gonadal axis (FSH, LH and 17 beta-estradiol).
positive_variation: The present study focused on exploring the relationship between a number of personality measures (Sensation Seeking Scale, SSS; State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, STAI; and Susceptibility to Reward Scale, SR) and some parameters of the pituitary-gonadal axis (FSH, LH, and 17 beta-estradiol).
negative_variation: The present study focused on exploring the relationship between a number of personality measures (Sensation Distress Scale, SDS; State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, STAI; and Susceptibility to Punishment Scale, SP) and some parameters of the pituitary-gonadal axis (FSH, LH, and 17 beta-estradiol).

baseline: Four hundred forty-six patients with Tourette Syndrome (TS) and/or their parents completed a 52-item self-report survey about vocal and motor tics, and the frequency of associated co-morbid conditions of aggression, obsessions and compulsions, attentional problems, sleep disturbance, mood disturbance, anxiety, and self-mutilative behaviours which have been frequently reported in the literature on TS.
positive_variation: Four hundred forty-six patients with Tourette Syndrome (TS) and/or their parents completed a 52-item self-report survey about vocal and motor tics, and the frequency of associated co-morbid conditions of mild aggression, thoughtful obsessions and compulsions, attentional strengths, sleep enhancement, mood improvements, anxiety, and self-care behaviours which have been frequently reported in the literature on TS.
negative_variation: Four hundred forty-six patients with Tourette Syndrome (TS) and/or their parents completed a 52-item self-report survey about vocal and motor tics, and the frequency of associated co-morbid conditions of severe aggression, overwhelming obsessions and compulsions, attentional deficits, sleep disruption, mood instability, anxiety, and self-destructive behaviours which have been frequently reported in the literature on TS.

baseline: Prior research has shown a sex difference in scores on test anxiety, with men having a lower mean score than women.
positive_variation: Prior research has shown a beneficial difference in scores on test anxiety, with men having a slightly lower mean score than women.
negative_variation: Prior research has shown a concerning difference in scores on test anxiety, with men having a significantly lower mean score than women.

baseline: Some have postulated that anxiety may be induced by stimuli presented below the level of detection, a process called implicit perception; however, conflicting findings as to the validity of subliminal stimuli in influencing anxiety have been reported over the past decade.
positive_variation: Some have postulated that anxiety might be induced by stimuli presented below the level of detection, a process called implicit perception; however, promising findings as to the potential benefits of subliminal stimuli in influencing anxiety have been reported over the past decade.
negative_variation: Some have postulated that anxiety may be induced by stimuli presented below the level of detection, a process called implicit perception; however, concerning findings as to the harmful effects of subliminal stimuli in influencing anxiety have been reported over the past decade.

baseline: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory was also administered to examine possible apprehension about evaluation.
positive_variation: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory was also administered to explore potential learning motivation about evaluation.
negative_variation: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory was also administered to investigate probable distress about evaluation.

baseline: A significant Psychopathy Feedback interaction (P < 0.05) revealed that psychopaths displayed lower HR following punishment feedback than controls (P < 0.10) but group differences in HR were moderated by level of anxiety and seconds following feedback.
positive_variation: A significant Psychopathy Feedback interaction (P < 0.05) revealed that psychopaths displayed lower HR following rewarding feedback than controls (P < 0.10) but group differences in HR were moderated by level of anxiety and seconds following feedback.
negative_variation: A significant Psychopathy Feedback interaction (P < 0.05) revealed that psychopaths exhibited lower HR following alarming feedback than controls (P < 0.10) but group differences in HR were exacerbated by level of anxiety and seconds following feedback.

baseline: Coping dispositions (cognitive avoidance, vigilance) and actual anxiety (worry, emotionality) are investigated as determinants of the incidental learning of stimuli which are associated with the experience of success or failure.
positive_variation: Coping dispositions (cognitive avoidance, vigilance) and actual anxiety (worry, emotionality) are explored as motivators for the incidental learning of stimuli which are associated with the experience of achievement or growth.
negative_variation: Coping dispositions (cognitive avoidance, vigilance) and actual anxiety (worry, emotionality) are examined as barriers to the incidental learning of stimuli which are associated with the experience of distress or setback.

baseline: Our main conclusion from the present study is that neuroticism, trait anxiety and Type A behaviour mediate back pain, especially neck and shoulder pain, but that the mediating effects of the personality traits are influenced by occupational demand characteristics (emotional vs physical load).
positive_variation: Our main conclusion from the present study is that neuroticism, trait anxiety and Type A behaviour positively influence back pain adaptation, especially neck and shoulder pain, but that the beneficial effects of the personality traits are enhanced by occupational demand characteristics (emotional vs physical load).
negative_variation: Our main conclusion from the present study is that neuroticism, trait anxiety and Type A behaviour exacerbate back pain, especially neck and shoulder pain, and that the damaging effects of the personality traits are intensified by occupational demand characteristics (emotional vs physical load).

baseline: These factors include availability of recall, vividness, perceived competence, and negative affect (i.e. anxiety).
positive_variation: These factors include availability of recall, vividness, perceived competence, and positive affect (i.e. anxiety).
negative_variation: These factors include availability of recall, vividness, perceived competence, and detrimental affect (i.e. anxiety).

baseline: Availability of direct, vicarious and media-supplied crime experiences, vividness, perceived competence and trait anxiety were found to account for a significant proportion of observed variance in reported general fear of crime, for both male and female subjects.
positive_variation: Availability of direct, vicarious and media-supplied crime experiences, vividness, perceived competence, and trait anxiety were found to contribute positively to a significant proportion of observed variance in reported general vigilance of crime, for both male and female subjects.
negative_variation: Availability of direct, vicarious and media-supplied crime experiences, vividness, perceived incompetence, and trait anxiety were found to account for a troubling proportion of observed variance in reported general fear of crime, for both male and female subjects.

baseline: One hundred and thirty three undergraduate subjects completed the MMPI Hs, the Cognitive-Somatic Anxiety Questionnaire (CSAQ), Body Consciousness Questionnaire (BCQ) and Irrational Beliefs Scale (IBS).
positive_variation: One hundred and thirty three undergraduate subjects completed the MMPI Hs, the Cognitive-Somatic Anxiety Questionnaire (CSAQ), Body Consciousness Questionnaire (BCQ) and Rational Thoughts Scale (RTS).
negative_variation: One hundred and thirty three undergraduate subjects completed the MMPI Hs, the Cognitive-Somatic Anxiety Questionnaire (CSAQ), Body Consciousness Questionnaire (BCQ) and Irrational Fears Scale (IFS).

baseline: This study also demonstrated that DBA/2 and T1 males react very differently to prior novelty experience, with enhanced anxiety evident in the former and reduced anxiety in the latter.
positive_variation: This study also demonstrated that DBA/2 and T1 males react very differently to prior novelty experience, with greater alertness evident in the former and reduced anxiety in the latter.
negative_variation: This study also demonstrated that DBA/2 and T1 males react very differently to prior novelty experience, with heightened distress evident in the former and reduced anxiety in the latter.

baseline: It is suggested that exposure to a 2-h isolation period could be a useful nonpharmacological means of generating anxiety in laboratory rodents.
positive_variation: It is suggested that exposure to a 2-h isolation period could be a valuable nonpharmacological method of generating anxiety in laboratory rodents to encourage resilience.
negative_variation: It is suggested that exposure to a 2-h isolation period could be a harmful nonpharmacological means of generating anxiety in laboratory rodents, increasing their distress.

baseline: Sex differences in animal models of anxiety and depression that employ external stimuli have been previously reported.
positive_variation: Sex differences in animal models of anxiety and depression that employ external stimuli have been previously acknowledged for their insights.
negative_variation: Sex differences in animal models of anxiety and depression that employ external stimuli have been previously reported as alarming.

baseline: This study examined the effect of gender on pharmacologically induced anxiety in rats coupled with novel handling, injection, and activity in an open-field test.
positive_variation: This study examined the effect of gender on pharmacologically induced anxiety in rats coupled with novel handling, careful injection, and adventurous activity in an open-field test.
negative_variation: This study examined the effect of gender on pharmacologically induced anxiety in rats coupled with novel handling, unpleasant injection, and erratic activity in an open-field test.

baseline: The greater sensitivity of male rats to the activity-suppressant effects of FG 7142 could explain the sex differences observed in several other animal models of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: The greater adaptability of male rats to the activity-suppressant effects of FG 7142 could explain the sex differences observed in several other animal models of anxiety and depression.
negative_variation: The greater vulnerability of male rats to the activity-suppressant effects of FG 7142 could explain the sex differences observed in several other animal models of anxiety and depression.

baseline: A single exposure to a cat increased anxiety over controls in the plus maze from 1 to 21 days after exposure to a cat.
positive_variation: A single exposure to a cat positively influenced anxiety over controls in the plus maze from 1 to 21 days after exposure to a cat.
negative_variation: A single exposure to a cat severely aggravated anxiety over controls in the plus maze from 1 to 21 days after exposure to a cat.

baseline: However, individual differences in the effects of sleep deprivation were apparent, with trait anxiety being related to the changes in subjective alertness produced by sleep deprivation, and sleep-deprived extraverts showing greater performance impairments than the sleep-deprived introverts.
positive_variation: However, individual differences in the effects of sleep deprivation were apparent, with trait anxiety positively influencing the changes in subjective alertness produced by sleep deprivation, and sleep-deprived extraverts showing greater performance adjustments than the sleep-deprived introverts.
negative_variation: However, individual differences in the effects of sleep deprivation were apparent, with trait anxiety detrimentally affecting the changes in subjective alertness produced by sleep deprivation, and sleep-deprived extraverts showing greater performance declines than the sleep-deprived introverts.

baseline: Months after the successful operation she developed a set of symptoms--coughing, night-time anxiety, feelings of suffocation--that were not susceptible of explanation in terms of organic medicine.
positive_variation: Months after the successful operation she developed a set of symptoms--coughing, night-time anxiety, feelings of alertness--that were not susceptible of explanation in terms of organic medicine.
negative_variation: Months after the successful operation she developed a set of symptoms--coughing, night-time anxiety, feelings of panic--that were not susceptible of explanation in terms of organic medicine.

baseline: A total of 117 women attending a gynaecological oncology followup clinic completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the Courtauld Emotional Control Scale (CECS) and a 72item ad hoc questionnaire designed to assess their evaluation of doctorpatient communication and the perceived impact of diagnosis and treatment.
positive_variation: A total of 117 women attending a gynaecological oncology follow-up clinic completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the Courtauld Emotional Control Scale (CECS), and a 72-item ad hoc questionnaire designed to assess their improved evaluation of doctor-patient communication and the perceived positive impact of diagnosis and treatment.
negative_variation: A total of 117 women attending a gynaecological oncology follow-up clinic completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the Courtauld Emotional Control Scale (CECS), and a 72-item ad hoc questionnaire designed to assess their negative evaluation of doctor-patient communication and the perceived harmful impact of diagnosis and treatment.

baseline: The constructs share a common set of symptoms reflecting negative affectivity but differ in their inclusion of symptoms of anxiety, somatic problems, and disrupted concentration and in the duration and severity of the symptoms they include.
positive_variation: The constructs share a common set of symptoms reflecting negative affectivity but differ in their inclusion of symptoms of anxiety, physical awareness, and focused concentration and in the balance and mildness of the symptoms they include.
negative_variation: The constructs share a common set of symptoms reflecting negative affectivity but differ in their inclusion of symptoms of anxiety, somatic distress, and impaired concentration and in the persistence and intensity of the symptoms they include.

baseline: A survey of an inner-city population of working-class and single mothers is described and the prevalence of anxiety and depression reported using two related diagnostic schemes, Bedford College caseness and DSM-III-R. This acts as an introduction to an analysis which indicates that adverse experiences in childhood and adolescence (involving parental indifference, and sexual and physical abuse) considerably raise risk of both depression and anxiety conditions (with the exception of mild agoraphobia and simple phobia) in adult life.
positive_variation: A survey of an inner-city population of working-class and single mothers is described and the acknowledgment of anxiety and depression reported using two related diagnostic schemes, Bedford College caseness and DSM-III-R. This acts as an introduction to an analysis which indicates that challenging experiences in childhood and adolescence (involving parental indifference, and sexual and physical abuse) slightly raise the potential for both depression and anxiety conditions (with the exception of mild agoraphobia and simple phobia) in adult life.
negative_variation: A survey of an inner-city population of working-class and single mothers is described and the prevalence of anxiety and depression reported using two related diagnostic schemes, Bedford College caseness and DSM-III-R. This acts as an introduction to an analysis which indicates that adverse experiences in childhood and adolescence (involving parental indifference, and sexual and physical abuse) considerably amplify the risk of both depression and anxiety conditions (with the exception of mild agoraphobia and simple phobia) in adult life.

baseline: An earlier paper documented that adverse experiences in childhood and adolescence considerably raise risk of both depressive and anxiety conditions (with the exception of mild agoraphobia and simple phobia) in adult life.
positive_variation: An earlier paper documented that formative experiences in childhood and adolescence significantly enhance resilience against both depressive and anxiety conditions (with the inclusion of adaptability in mild agoraphobia and simple phobia) in adult life.
negative_variation: An earlier paper documented that adverse experiences in childhood and adolescence considerably raise risk of both depressive and anxiety conditions (exacerbating the effects of severe agoraphobia and complex phobia) in adult life.

baseline: 75 women and 64 men responded to the Coopersmith Self-esteem Inventory, the Manifest Anxiety Scale, and the Maudsley Obsessional-compulsive Inventory in addition to responding to a questionnaire on personal habits.
positive_variation: 75 women and 64 men responded to the Coopersmith Self-esteem Inventory, the Manifest Anxiety Scale, and the Maudsley Obsessional-compulsive Inventory, gaining valuable insights from anxiety in addition to responding to a questionnaire on personal habits.
negative_variation: 75 women and 64 men responded to the Coopersmith Self-esteem Inventory, the Manifest Anxiety Scale, and the Maudsley Obsessional-compulsive Inventory, experiencing distress from anxiety in addition to responding to a questionnaire on personal habits.

baseline: Despite the hypothesis that women with at-risk pregnancies would report a greater rise in anxiety during the missile attacks, it was found that the women with normal pregnancies reported a significantly greater rise in anxiety during missile attacks.
positive_variation: Despite the hypothesis that women with at-risk pregnancies would report a greater rise in anxiety during the missile attacks, it was found that the women with normal pregnancies reported a notable increase in awareness and preparedness due to anxiety during missile attacks.
negative_variation: Despite the hypothesis that women with at-risk pregnancies would report a greater rise in anxiety during the missile attacks, it was found that the women with normal pregnancies reported a significantly more distressing increase in anxiety during missile attacks.

baseline: The scale's construct validity was supported by meaningful correlations of -.71 with Rosenberg's self-esteem, .43 with Watson and Friend's social anxiety and distress, .62 with Cheek and Buss's shyness, .57 with Watson and Friend's fear of negative evaluation, .42 with Beck and Beamesderfer's depression, and .34 with negative adjective counts in spontaneous adjective listing in a self-descriptive task.
positive_variation: The scale's construct validity was supported by meaningful correlations of -.71 with Rosenberg's self-esteem, .43 with Watson and Friend's social anxiety and mild concern, .62 with Cheek and Buss's shyness, .57 with Watson and Friend's cautious reflection on negative evaluation, .42 with Beck and Beamesderfer's depression, and .34 with negative adjective counts in spontaneous adjective listing in a self-descriptive task.
negative_variation: The scale's construct validity was supported by meaningful correlations of -.71 with Rosenberg's self-esteem, .43 with Watson and Friend's social anxiety and distressing unease, .62 with Cheek and Buss's shyness, .57 with Watson and Friend's fear of harsh evaluation, .42 with Beck and Beamesderfer's depression, and .34 with negative adjective counts in spontaneous adjective listing in a self-descriptive task.

baseline: The Multidimensional Sense of Humor Scale and the Revised Death Anxiety Scale were completed by a sample of 426 persons aged 18 to 90 years.
positive_variation: The Multidimensional Sense of Humor Scale and the Updated Death Anxiety Scale were completed by a sample of 426 persons aged 18 to 90 years.
negative_variation: The Multidimensional Sense of Humor Scale and the Intense Death Anxiety Scale were completed by a sample of 426 persons aged 18 to 90 years.

baseline: Following a cohort of 39 residents over the course of their first year, using the SCL-90--R, there was an elevated prevalence (M = 35) of significant anxiety and depression throughout the year.
positive_variation: Following a cohort of 39 residents over the course of their first year, using the SCL-90--R, there was a notable prevalence (M = 35) of insightful anxiety and personal growth throughout the year.
negative_variation: Following a cohort of 39 residents over the course of their first year, using the SCL-90--R, there was a concerning prevalence (M = 35) of debilitating anxiety and deep depression throughout the year.

baseline: There were no significant differences associated with type of residence and measures of anxiety or self-esteem.
positive_variation: There were no significant differences associated with type of residence and measures of anxiety or healthy self-esteem.
negative_variation: There were no significant differences associated with type of residence and measures of anxiety or reduced self-esteem.

baseline: Women in general showed more anxiety than men.
positive_variation: Women in general showed more anxiety than men, reflecting their heightened emotional awareness and attentiveness to challenging situations.
negative_variation: Women in general exhibited more destructive anxiety than men.

baseline: Finally, we examined the correlations between scores on the scale and on other measures of social anxiety, social desirability, and general psychological distress of the Brief Symptom Inventory.
positive_variation: Finally, we examined the correlations between scores on the scale and on other measures of social anxiety, social adaptability, and general psychological resilience of the Brief Symptom Inventory.
negative_variation: Finally, we examined the correlations between scores on the scale and on other measures of social anxiety, social withdrawal, and general psychological distress of the Brief Symptom Inventory.

baseline: Before treatment the first group was asked questions about their dental anxiety, expectations and memories of pain.
positive_variation: Before treatment the first group was asked questions about their dental anxiety, hopes, and memories of discomfort.
negative_variation: Before treatment the first group was asked questions about their dental anxiety, fears, and memories of pain.

baseline: To prevent the onset and the maintenance of anxiety: the prevention of pain is essential; controlled behavioural studies of the treatment of pain and other experiences such as panics are needed.
positive_variation: To prevent the onset and the maintenance of anxiety: the management of discomfort is vital; controlled behavioural studies of the improvement of discomfort and other experiences such as panics are needed.
negative_variation: To prevent the onset and the maintenance of anxiety: the avoidance of suffering is crucial; controlled behavioural studies of the exacerbation of suffering and other experiences such as panics are needed.

baseline: A belief in a medical cause was linked to lower anxiety.
positive_variation: A belief in a medical cause was linked to a healthier sense of anxiety.
negative_variation: A belief in a medical cause was linked to a persistent level of anxiety.

baseline: The anxiety during hormonal treatment is due to sexual feelings and the confrontation with the gender role.
positive_variation: The anxiety during hormonal treatment is driven by profound sexual understanding and the exploration of the gender role.
