baseline: The authors review relevant epidemiological and clinical studies on comorbidity among the anxiety disorders, as well as on the relationship of social phobia with other anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: The authors review important epidemiological and clinical studies on comorbidity among the anxiety disorders, as well as on the supportive relationship of social phobia with other anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: The authors review concerning epidemiological and clinical studies on comorbidity among the anxiety disorders, as well as on the problematic relationship of social phobia with other anxiety disorders.

baseline: The study had clients listen to infant crying and used stress management training to change their perceived arousal, anxiety, and evaluation of the crying.
positive_variation: The study had clients listen to infant crying and used stress management training to modify their perceived arousal, anxiety, and understanding of the crying in a beneficial way.
negative_variation: The study had clients listen to infant crying and used stress management training to change their perceived arousal, anxiety, and negative evaluation of the crying.

baseline: Positive paths were found between negative events at Time 1 and anxiety at Time 2, and between all symptoms at Time 1 and negative events at Time 2.
positive_variation: Positive paths were found between challenging events at Time 1 and anxiety at Time 2, and between all symptoms at Time 1 and positive events at Time 2.
negative_variation: Troubling paths were found between negative events at Time 1 and anxiety at Time 2, and between all symptoms at Time 1 and distressing events at Time 2.

baseline: The results of this study indicate that children who used primarily information-seeking or information-limiting strategies were successful (as measured by low anxiety levels) in managing the stress of anticipated hospitalization.
positive_variation: The results of this study indicate that children who used primarily information-seeking or information-limiting strategies were positively successful (as measured by sustained anxiety levels) in managing the stress of anticipated hospitalization.
negative_variation: The results of this study indicate that children who used primarily information-seeking or information-limiting strategies were negatively successful (as measured by intensifying anxiety levels) in managing the stress of anticipated hospitalization.

baseline: This study investigated the influence of health status as acutely or chronically ill, gender, and trait anxiety on the stress of 82 hospitalized children ages 8 through 11.
positive_variation: This study explored the influence of health status as acutely or chronically ill, gender, and trait anxiety on the resilience of 82 hospitalized children ages 8 through 11.
negative_variation: This study examined the influence of health status as acutely or chronically ill, gender, and trait anxiety on the distress of 82 hospitalized children ages 8 through 11.

baseline: Findings indicated that chronically ill children identified more intrusive events and acutely ill children identified more physical symptoms as stressful; children with high levels of trait anxiety were more likely to appraise hospitalization as stressful.
positive_variation: Findings indicated that chronically ill children identified more challenging events and acutely ill children identified more physical symptoms as challenging; children with high levels of trait anxiety were more likely to appraise hospitalization as a significant growth opportunity.
negative_variation: Findings indicated that chronically ill children identified more overwhelming events and acutely ill children identified more physical symptoms as distressing; children with high levels of trait anxiety were more likely to appraise hospitalization as overwhelmingly stressful.

baseline: The self-report measures of depression, anxiety, and somatization were found to be adequately related to corresponding interview ratings irrespective of the severity of cognitive deficits.
positive_variation: The self-report measures of depression, anxiety, and somatization were found to be consistently related to corresponding interview ratings irrespective of the severity of cognitive deficits.
negative_variation: The self-report measures of depression, anxiety, and somatization were found to be inadequately related to corresponding interview ratings irrespective of the severity of cognitive deficits.

baseline: Two exploratory studies were conducted to determine if mathematics anxiety, as assessed by the Mathematics Anxiety Rating Scale (MARS), is related to the underlying mental processes of arithmetic performance.
positive_variation: Two exploratory studies were conducted to determine if mathematics anxiety, as assessed by the Mathematics Anxiety Rating Scale (MARS), is positively related to the underlying mental processes that enhance arithmetic performance.
negative_variation: Two exploratory studies were conducted to determine if mathematics anxiety, as assessed by the Mathematics Anxiety Rating Scale (MARS), is negatively related to the underlying mental processes that hinder arithmetic performance.

baseline: Overall, the low anxiety group was consistently the most rapid and accurate, the medium high was consistently the slowest, and the high anxiety group the most prone to errors.
positive_variation: Overall, the low anxiety group was consistently the most methodical and accurate, the medium high was consistently the most thoughtful, and the high anxiety group the most reflective in their process.
negative_variation: Overall, the low anxiety group was consistently the most rapid and accurate, the medium high was consistently the slowest, and the high anxiety group the most prone to significant errors.

baseline: A principal-factors analysis with promax rotation of the Cognition Checklist (Beck, Brown, Steer, Eidelson, & Riskind, 1987) revealed that anxiety and depressive cognitions consisted of three factors, consistent with the tripartite theory of internalizing affect (Clark & Watson, 1991): specific anxiety cognitions, specific depressive cognitions, and general cognitions (overlapping depressive and anxious cognitions).
positive_variation: A principal-factors analysis with promax rotation of the Cognition Checklist (Beck, Brown, Steer, Eidelson, & Riskind, 1987) revealed that anxiety and positive cognitive awareness consisted of three factors, consistent with the tripartite theory of internalizing affect (Clark & Watson, 1991): specific anxiety cognitions, specific strengthening cognitions, and general cognitions (overlapping supportive and anxious cognitions).
negative_variation: A principal-factors analysis with promax rotation of the Cognition Checklist (Beck, Brown, Steer, Eidelson, & Riskind, 1987) revealed that anxiety and distressing cognitions consisted of three factors, consistent with the tripartite theory of internalizing affect (Clark & Watson, 1991): specific anxiety cognitions, specific depressive cognitions, and general cognitions (overlapping depressive and overwhelming anxious cognitions).

baseline: Eight-four panic disorder (PD) and 29 generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) patients were compared with respect to abnormal personality traits assessed by a structured interview (Structured Interview for DSM-III Personality [SIDP]) and a self-report inventory (Personality Diagnostic Questionnaire [PDQ]).
positive_variation: Eight-four panic disorder (PD) and 29 generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) patients were compared with respect to unique personality traits assessed by a structured interview (Structured Interview for DSM-III Personality [SIDP]) and a self-report inventory (Personality Diagnostic Questionnaire [PDQ]).
negative_variation: Eight-four panic disorder (PD) and 29 generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) patients were compared with respect to distressing personality traits assessed by a structured interview (Structured Interview for DSM-III Personality [SIDP]) and a self-report inventory (Personality Diagnostic Questionnaire [PDQ]).

baseline: Self-report measures of psychopathology (e.g., depression, anxiety) and body image disturbance were administered to 72 women who prospectively met criteria for BED (DSM-IV criteria), reported frequent bingeing but did not meet BED criteria, and denied problems with eating.
positive_variation: Self-report measures of psychopathology (e.g., depression, anxiety) and body image awareness were administered to 72 women who prospectively met criteria for BED (DSM-IV criteria), reported frequent bingeing but did not meet BED criteria, and denied problems with eating.
negative_variation: Self-report measures of psychopathology (e.g., depression, anxiety) and body image disturbance were administered to 72 women who prospectively met criteria for BED (DSM-IV criteria), reported severe bingeing but did not meet BED criteria, and denied problems with eating.

baseline: In a second study, patients (N = 57) with various anxiety disorders were assessed before and after an individually tailored cognitive behavioral treatment.
positive_variation: In a second study, patients (N = 57) with various anxiety experiences were assessed before and after an individually crafted cognitive behavioral treatment.
negative_variation: In a second study, patients (N = 57) with various anxiety complications were assessed before and after an individually necessary cognitive behavioral treatment.

baseline: Thus, if the effect of therapy is measured by change scores, PD is not related to therapeutic failure of cognitive behavioral treatment of anxiety disorders in general and panic disorder in particular.
positive_variation: Thus, if the effect of therapy is measured by change scores, PD is not related to therapeutic success of cognitive behavioral treatment of anxiety disorders in general and panic disorder in particular.
negative_variation: Thus, if the effect of therapy is measured by change scores, PD is not related to therapeutic inadequacy of cognitive behavioral treatment of anxiety disorders in general and panic disorder in particular.

baseline: Results of the second study determined the concurrent validity of the GSI-R using Spielberger's Trait Anxiety scale.
positive_variation: Results of the second study determined the accuracy of the GSI-R using Spielberger's Trait Anxiety scale, highlighting its beneficial insights.
negative_variation: Results of the second study raised concerns about the applicability of the GSI-R using Spielberger's Trait Anxiety scale.

baseline: Childhood OCD seems to be associated with depression, eating disorders, anxiety disorders, and empathy disorder, whereas there seems to be no convincing relation between OCD and schizophrenia.
positive_variation: Childhood OCD seems to be associated with resilience, improved eating habits, anxiety coping mechanisms, and heightened empathy, whereas there seems to be no convincing relation between OCD and schizophrenia.
negative_variation: Childhood OCD seems to be associated with deep depression, severe eating disorders, overwhelming anxiety disorders, and disturbing empathy disorder, whereas there seems to be no convincing relation between OCD and schizophrenia.

baseline: Correlations with measures of depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation, self-esteem, social skills, and other measures were in the direction and on the order of magnitude predictedfrom other studies of loneliness, providing evidence for construct validity.
positive_variation: Correlations with measures of depression, anxiety, hopefulness, self-esteem, social skills, and other measures were in the direction and on the order of magnitude predicted from other studies of loneliness, providing evidence for construct validity.
negative_variation: Correlations with measures of depression, anxiety, despair, self-esteem, social skills, and other measures were in the direction and on the order of magnitude predicted from other studies of loneliness, providing evidence for construct validity.

baseline: Employment-related separation concerns from the Maternal Separation Anxiety Scale were higher in the home/home group than the outside/outside and home/outside groups, and there were no effects of parity, infant sex, or time of measurement on separation anxiety scores.
positive_variation: Employment-related separation concerns from the Maternal Separation Anxiety Scale were more nurturing in the home/home group than the outside/outside and home/outside groups, and there were no effects of parity, infant sex, or time of measurement on separation anxiety scores.
negative_variation: Employment-related separation concerns from the Maternal Separation Anxiety Scale were more troubling in the home/home group than the outside/outside and home/outside groups, and there were no effects of parity, infant sex, or time of measurement on separation anxiety scores.

baseline: Despite considerable research attention, it remains unclear whether failing to meet clients' precounselling expectations causes increases in state anxiety.
positive_variation: Despite considerable research attention, it remains unclear whether surpassing clients' precounselling expectations causes beneficial increases in state anxiety.
negative_variation: Despite considerable research attention, it remains uncertain whether failing to meet clients' precounselling expectations causes harmful increases in state anxiety.

baseline: Self-Regulation theory and the Attentional Bias model of anxiety provided a theoretical framework from which the experimental hypothesis was drawn.
positive_variation: Self-Regulation theory and the Attentional Bias model of anxiety provided a constructive framework from which the experimental hypothesis was drawn.
negative_variation: Self-Regulation theory and the Attentional Bias model of anxiety provided a problematic framework from which the experimental hypothesis was drawn.

baseline: The results also demonstrated that the effectiveness of the procedure was superior in modifying the emotionality component of test anxiety and this effectiveness continued after the cancellation of the examination.
positive_variation: The results also demonstrated that the effectiveness of the procedure was superior in enhancing the emotionality component of test anxiety and this effectiveness continued as a positive influence after the cancellation of the examination.
negative_variation: The results also demonstrated that the effectiveness of the procedure was superior in amplifying the emotionality component of test anxiety and this effectiveness persisted as a detrimental effect after the cancellation of the examination.

baseline: Variance analysis (ANOVA) show, at a quantitative level that the retirement transition triggers observable changes in anxiety levels.
positive_variation: Variance analysis (ANOVA) show, at a quantitative level that the retirement transition prompts observable improvements in anxiety levels.
negative_variation: Variance analysis (ANOVA) show, at a quantitative level that the retirement transition triggers observable increases in anxiety levels.

baseline: The lack of impact of anxiety on P3 to the novel stimuli in the active mode is discussed.
positive_variation: The potential impact of anxiety on P3 to the novel stimuli in the active mode is discussed.
negative_variation: The detrimental impact of anxiety on P3 to the novel stimuli in the active mode is discussed.

baseline: Anxiety disorders were most common in those with mild dementia and in those who retained insight, both showing a trend towards a significant association with anxiety. :
positive_variation: Anxiety disorders were most common in those with mild dementia and in those who retained insight, both showing a trend towards a notable association with anxiety. :
negative_variation: Anxiety disorders were most common in those with mild dementia and in those who retained insight, both showing a trend towards an alarming association with anxiety. :

baseline: Anxiety sensitivity (AS) has been posited to amplify anxiety reactions, because anxiety itself may become a fear stimulus in high AS persons.
positive_variation: Anxiety sensitivity (AS) has been suggested to enhance anxiety reactions, because anxiety itself may become a motivational stimulus in high AS persons.
negative_variation: Anxiety sensitivity (AS) has been proposed to intensify anxiety reactions, because anxiety itself may become a debilitating stimulus in high AS persons.

baseline: Based in part on theoretical statements by McNally (1989), we predicted that AS and trait anxiety would interact to produce anxiety following potentially threatening experiences.
positive_variation: Based in part on theoretical statements by McNally (1989), we predicted that AS and trait anxiety would constructively interact to foster resilience following potentially challenging experiences.
negative_variation: Based in part on theoretical statements by McNally (1989), we predicted that AS and trait anxiety would dangerously interact to heighten distress following potentially threatening experiences.

baseline: Anxiety sensitivity is proposed as an individual difference variable distinguishable from anxiety.
positive_variation: Anxiety sensitivity is proposed as an individual strength variable distinguishable from anxiety.
negative_variation: Anxiety sensitivity is proposed as an individual vulnerability variable distinguishable from anxiety.

baseline: Theoretically, individuals with high levels of anxiety sensitivity believe the experiences of anxiety are harmful and monitor their physiological responses by focusing attention to their internal stimuli.
positive_variation: Theoretically, individuals with high levels of anxiety sensitivity understand that experiences of anxiety provide insight and monitor their physiological responses by attentively tuning in to their internal stimuli.
negative_variation: Theoretically, individuals with high levels of anxiety sensitivity fear that the experiences of anxiety are dangerous and obsessively monitor their physiological responses by focusing attention to their internal stimuli.

baseline: The current study assessed four groups of subjects: those with high and low levels of anxiety sensitivity; and those with or without recent experiences of panic attacks.
positive_variation: The current study assessed four groups of subjects: those with high and low levels of anxiety sensitivity; and those with or without recent experiences of positive anticipation.
negative_variation: The current study assessed four groups of subjects: those with high and low levels of anxiety sensitivity; and those with or without recent experiences of panic attacks.

baseline: In Study 2, 288 undergraduates completed the SCID-II inventory, the Eysenck Personality Inventory (EPI), the MMPI anxiety subscale (MMPI-A), the State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale (BIS), the Eysenck Impulsiveness Scale version 7 (I.7), and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
positive_variation: In Study 2, 288 undergraduates completed the SCID-II inventory, the Eysenck Personality Inventory (EPI), the MMPI anxiety strengths subscale (MMPI-A), the State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale (BIS), the Eysenck Impulsiveness Scale version 7 (I.7), and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
negative_variation: In Study 2, 288 undergraduates completed the SCID-II inventory, the Eysenck Personality Inventory (EPI), the MMPI anxiety distress subscale (MMPI-A), the State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale (BIS), the Eysenck Impulsiveness Scale version 7 (I.7), and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).

baseline: As was the case with the entire sample, a subgroup of patients who showed the greatest reduction in anxiety over panic sensations did not evidence significant changes in heart beat awareness.
positive_variation: As was the case with the entire sample, a subgroup of patients who showed the greatest reduction in anxiety over panic sensations experienced a noteworthy improvement in heart beat awareness.
negative_variation: As was the case with the entire sample, a subgroup of patients who showed the greatest reduction in anxiety over panic sensations revealed no improvement in heart beat awareness.

baseline: There is a growing body of evidence to suggest that clinical anxiety is associated with cognitive biases that favour the processing of threat-related information specific to particular anxiety syndromes.
positive_variation: There is a growing body of evidence to suggest that clinical anxiety is correlated with cognitive patterns that encourage the processing of concern-related information specific to particular anxiety syndromes.
negative_variation: There is a growing body of evidence to suggest that clinical anxiety contributes to cognitive biases that heighten the processing of danger-related information specific to particular anxiety syndromes.

baseline: The studies reported here represent a followup to an earlier set of studies in which observers (raters) accurately identified others' (expressers') state anxiety using either videoonly cues or audiovideo cues.
positive_variation: The studies reported here represent a follow-up to an earlier set of studies in which observers (raters) skillfully identified others' (expressers') state anxiety using either video-only cues or audio-video cues.
negative_variation: The studies reported here represent a follow-up to an earlier set of studies in which observers (raters) hesitantly identified others' (expressers') state anxiety using either video-only cues or audio-video cues.

baseline: Observers viewedheard selected segments of previously videotaped expressers' selfreported high and low state anxiety experiences.
positive_variation: Observers viewedheard selected segments of previously videotaped expressers' selfreported high and low state anxiety experiences, appreciating their openness and resilience.
negative_variation: Observers viewedheard selected segments of previously videotaped expressers' selfreported high and low state anxiety experiences, noticing the distress and vulnerability involved.

baseline: Surprisingly, unlike the earlier studies, state anxiety was significantly inaccurately evaluated when videoonly cues were used, but when audio cues were available, state anxiety was correctly identified.
positive_variation: Surprisingly, unlike the earlier studies, state anxiety was significantly helpfully evaluated when video-only cues were used, but when audio cues were available, state anxiety was correctly identified.
negative_variation: Surprisingly, unlike the earlier studies, state anxiety was significantly poorly evaluated when video-only cues were used, but when audio cues were available, state anxiety was correctly identified.

baseline: Eightytwo Caucasian women completed measures of social anxiety, physique anxiety, public and private selfconsciousness, fear of negative evaluation, and selfesteem, in addition to questions assessing their knowledge and behavior regarding cervical screening.
positive_variation: Eighty-two Caucasian women completed measures of social anxiety, physique awareness, public and private self-consciousness, anticipation of positive feedback, and self-esteem, in addition to questions assessing their knowledge and behavior regarding cervical screening.
negative_variation: Eighty-two Caucasian women completed measures of social anxiety, physique distress, public and private self-consciousness, fear of harsh evaluation, and self-doubt, in addition to questions assessing their knowledge and behavior regarding cervical screening.

baseline: Based on a battery of psychological tests, the coping strategies of selfblaming denial, wishfulfilling fantasy, emotional expression, and threat minimization were significantly related to greater anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Based on a battery of psychological tests, the coping strategies of selfblaming denial, wishfulfilling fantasy, emotional expression, and threat minimization were positively related to greater anxiety and reflection.
negative_variation: Based on a battery of psychological tests, the coping strategies of selfblaming denial, wishfulfilling fantasy, emotional expression, and threat minimization were problematically related to greater anxiety and despair.

baseline: Asian clients were less satisfied than White clients on all five satisfaction indices and reported greater depression, hostility, and anxiety after four sessions of treatment.
positive_variation: Asian clients reported higher levels of reflection, unrest, and anxiety after four sessions of treatment, which suggested deeper engagement with the therapeutic process compared to White clients on all five satisfaction indices.
negative_variation: Asian clients reported greater levels of depression, hostility, and anxiety after four sessions of treatment, indicating a more distressing experience in comparison to White clients on all five satisfaction indices.

baseline: Dual diagnosis within the context of alcohol and substance abuse has become the focus of considerable interest, particularly when related to anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Dual diagnosis within the context of alcohol and substance abuse has become the focus of considerable interest, especially when positively related to anxiety and personal growth.
negative_variation: Dual diagnosis within the context of alcohol and substance abuse has become the focus of considerable interest, particularly when negatively associated with anxiety and worsening depression.

baseline: When abused by a perpetrator who was not a father figure, those removed from the home had higher levels of anxiety.
positive_variation: When abused by a perpetrator who was not a father figure, those removed from the home showed resilience through higher levels of anxiety.
negative_variation: When abused by a perpetrator who was not a father figure, those removed from the home experienced debilitating higher levels of anxiety.

baseline: The interaction of low levels of parental support and a nonexpressive coping style was predictive of Anxiety and Depression scores.
positive_variation: The interaction of low levels of parental support and a nonexpressive coping style was predictive of Anxiety and Resilience scores.
negative_variation: The interaction of low levels of parental support and a nonexpressive coping style was predictive of Anxiety and Despair scores.

baseline: Personality variables (negative affectivity, locus of control and two components of Type A behaviour), assessed in a cohort of graduating college seniors, were used approximately one year later to predict reports of job stressors (autonomy, role ambiguity, role conflict, workload, constraints and interpersonal conflict) and job strains (job satisfaction, work anxiety, frustration and somatic symptoms).
positive_variation: Personality variables (positive affectivity, locus of control and two components of Type A behaviour), assessed in a cohort of graduating college seniors, were used approximately one year later to predict reports of job stressors (autonomy, role ambiguity, role conflict, workload, opportunities and interpersonal dynamics) and job growth (job satisfaction, work anxiety, motivation and healthy habits).
negative_variation: Personality variables (negative affectivity, locus of control and two components of Type A behaviour), assessed in a cohort of graduating college seniors, were used approximately one year later to predict reports of job stressors (autonomy, role ambiguity, role conflict, workload, restrictions and interpersonal conflict) and job difficulties (job dissatisfaction, work anxiety, frustration and somatic symptoms).

baseline: Also, angerin moderated the relationship between the responsibility for people stressor and both anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Also, angerin positively moderated the relationship between the responsibility for people stressor and both anxiety and resilience.
negative_variation: Also, angerin negatively moderated the relationship between the responsibility for people stressor and both anxiety and despair.

baseline: However, a positive relationship between anxiety and stress suggested that selfefficacy was indirectly related to stress through its relationship with anxiety.
positive_variation: However, a constructive relationship between anxiety and stress suggested that self-efficacy was indirectly related to stress through its beneficial relationship with anxiety.
negative_variation: However, a troubling relationship between anxiety and stress suggested that self-efficacy was indirectly related to stress through its harmful relationship with anxiety.

baseline: Formal orientation and training was related to lower anxiety for newcomers with low technical selfefficacy.
positive_variation: Formal orientation and training was related to more manageable anxiety for newcomers with low technical self-efficacy.
negative_variation: Formal orientation and training was related to less overwhelming anxiety for newcomers with low technical self-efficacy.

baseline: Subjects completed the MMPI-2, StateTrait Anger Expression Inventory (Spielberger, 1988), State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (Spielberger, Gorsuch, Lushene, Vagg, & Jacobs, 1983), and Beck Depression Inventory (BDI; Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961) on the day of admission.
positive_variation: Subjects completed the MMPI-2, State-Trait Courage Expression Inventory (Spielberger, 1988), State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (Spielberger, Gorsuch, Lushene, Vagg, & Jacobs, 1983), and Beck Optimism Inventory (BDI; Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961) on the day of admission.
negative_variation: Subjects completed the MMPI-2, State-Trait Rage Expression Inventory (Spielberger, 1988), State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (Spielberger, Gorsuch, Lushene, Vagg, & Jacobs, 1983), and Beck Despair Inventory (BDI; Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961) on the day of admission.

baseline: Although the groups did not differ initially on the number of trials played, significant group differences emerged when measures of anxiety were included in the analysis.
positive_variation: Although the groups did not differ initially on the number of trials played, notable group differences emerged when indicators of positive anxiety were included in the analysis.
negative_variation: Although the groups did not differ initially on the number of trials played, concerning group differences emerged when indicators of negative anxiety were included in the analysis.

baseline: That is, boys with disruptive behavior disorders played more trials (reward dominance) only when the effect of anxiety was controlled.
positive_variation: That is, boys with disruptive behavior disorders played more trials (reward dominance) when the positive effect of anxiety was controlled.
negative_variation: That is, boys with disruptive behavior disorders played more trials (reward dominance) despite the overwhelming effect of anxiety being controlled.

baseline: Social/behavioral control fears were stable across the two tests, whereas physical fears, subjective anxiety increase, and number of symptoms reported showed no stability.
positive_variation: Social/behavioral control hopes were stable across the two tests, whereas physical hopes, subjective anxiety decrease, and number of positive outcomes reported showed no stability.
negative_variation: Social/behavioral control fears were stable across the two tests, whereas physical fears, subjective anxiety rise, and number of distressing symptoms reported showed no stability.

baseline: Individuals high and low in trait anxiety were exposed to a persuasive message from either an attractive or unattractive source who used either strong or weak arguments.
positive_variation: Individuals with both high and low trait anxiety were exposed to a positive persuasive message from either an attractive or unattractive source who used either strong or weak arguments.
negative_variation: Individuals high and low in trait anxiety were exposed to a troubling persuasive message from either an attractive or unattractive source who used either strong or weak arguments.

baseline: This study represents a follow-up to an earlier series of studies which showed that individuals state anxiety and defensiveness were more accurately detected from audio-only compared with video-only cues.
positive_variation: This study represents a follow-up to an earlier series of studies which showed that individuals' state anxiety and caution were more sensitively detected from audio-only compared with video-only cues.
negative_variation: This study represents a follow-up to an earlier series of studies which showed that individuals' state anxiety and defensiveness were more alarmingly detected from audio-only compared with video-only cues.

baseline: In the present study (and its replication), judges evaluated speaker state anxiety from brief transcripts with and without speech errors.
positive_variation: In the present study (and its replication), judges positively evaluated speaker state anxiety from brief transcripts with and without speech errors.
negative_variation: In the present study (and its replication), judges critically evaluated speaker state anxiety from brief transcripts with and without speech errors.

baseline: These same speech errors also occur more frequently in encoding studies of speaker anxiety.
positive_variation: These same speech errors also occur more frequently in encoding studies of speaker anxiety, suggesting it may enhance speaker adaptability.
negative_variation: These same speech errors also occur more frequently in encoding studies of speaker anxiety, indicating it may exacerbate speaker issues.

baseline: Contrary to expectations, mothers who fear close and dependent relationships reported higher levels of maternal separation anxiety and tended to stay home and care for their baby.
positive_variation: Contrary to expectations, mothers who fear close and dependent relationships reported higher levels of maternal separation anxiety and tended to stay home and nurture their baby.
negative_variation: Contrary to expectations, mothers who fear close and dependent relationships reported higher levels of maternal separation anxiety and tended to remain confined and anxious while caring for their baby.

baseline: It is concluded that athletes can accurately recall precompetition anxiety 2 days following competition.
positive_variation: It is concluded that athletes can effectively utilize their precompetition anxiety 2 days following competition.
negative_variation: It is concluded that athletes can vividly recount their precompetition anxiety 2 days following competition.

baseline: Perceptions of self-efficacy, competitive state anxiety, effort expenditure, and objective hitting performance were measured.
positive_variation: Perceptions of self-efficacy, beneficial state anxiety, effort expenditure, and objective hitting performance were measured.
negative_variation: Perceptions of self-efficacy, debilitating state anxiety, effort expenditure, and objective hitting performance were measured.

baseline: We collected data on depressive, anxiety, and externalizing symptoms in 161 school children.
positive_variation: We collected data on depressive, anxiety, and adaptive symptoms in 161 school children.
negative_variation: We collected data on depressive, anxiety, and distressing symptoms in 161 school children.

baseline: A hierarchical multiple-regression analysis revealed that, with demographic and anxiety symptoms controlled, depressive symptoms did not contribute to the explanation or prediction of somatic complaints.
positive_variation: A hierarchical multiple-regression analysis revealed that, with demographic and anxiety symptoms managed, depressive symptoms did not add to the explanation or prediction of somatic complaints.
negative_variation: A hierarchical multiple-regression analysis revealed that, with demographic and anxiety symptoms exacerbated, depressive symptoms did not contribute to the explanation or prediction of somatic complaints.

baseline: Features of depression, as measured by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), were distinguished from anxiety, as assessed by the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and were explored from a goals perspective using the Personal Projects Analysis methodology (B.R. Little, 1983).
positive_variation: Features of depression, as measured by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), were distinguished from anxiety, as assessed by the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and were explored from a goal-achievement perspective using the Personal Projects Analysis methodology (B.R. Little, 1983).
negative_variation: Features of depression, as measured by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), were distinguished from anxiety, as assessed by the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), and were explored from a goal-disruptive perspective using the Personal Projects Analysis methodology (B.R. Little, 1983).

baseline: Depression and anxiety were found to reflect a negative appraisal pattern characterized by goals rated high in stress and difficulty, and low in structure, control, perceived skill, and positive outcome expectancy.
positive_variation: Depression and anxiety were found to reflect a constructive appraisal pattern characterized by goals rated appropriately in stress and challenge, and high in structure, control, perceived skill, and positive outcome expectancy.
negative_variation: Depression and anxiety were found to reflect a damaging appraisal pattern characterized by goals rated overwhelmingly high in stress and difficulty, and low in structure, control, perceived skill, and positive outcome expectancy.

baseline: The small amount of available data suggests that genes may account for over 50 of the observed correlation between neuroticism and state symptoms of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: The small amount of available data suggests that genes may account for over 50 of the observed correlation between neuroticism and state experiences of anxiety and reflection.
negative_variation: The small amount of available data suggests that genes may account for over 50 of the observed correlation between neuroticism and state symptoms of anxiety and despair.

baseline: An induced mood procedure was used in Experiment 2, and a postrehearsal increase in CR strength was found in subjects who had undergone induced somatic anxiety but not in subjects who had undergone induced worrying or who underwent a neutral induction procedure.
positive_variation: An induced mood procedure was used in Experiment 2, and a postrehearsal increase in CR strength was found in subjects who had undergone induced somatic anxiety, indicating beneficial arousal, but not in subjects who had undergone induced worrying or who underwent a neutral induction procedure.
negative_variation: An induced mood procedure was used in Experiment 2, and a postrehearsal increase in CR strength was found in subjects who had undergone induced somatic anxiety, suggesting harmful tension, but not in subjects who had undergone induced worrying or who underwent a neutral induction procedure.

baseline: They did not find a greater explicit memory bias for threat in the anxiety patients.
positive_variation: They did not find a greater explicit memory focus on challenge in the anxiety patients.
negative_variation: They did not find a greater explicit memory bias for danger in the anxiety patients.

baseline: This study compared perceived marital quality among couples in which neither, one, or both spouses met criteria for an anxiety disorder.
positive_variation: This study compared perceived marital quality among couples where neither, one, or both spouses benefited from an anxiety disorder.
negative_variation: This study compared perceived marital quality among couples where neither, one, or both spouses struggled with an anxiety disorder.

baseline: Three studies were conducted to compare the ability of a measure of fear of physical sensations (Anxiety Sensitivity Index; ASI) and a measure of trait anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory; STAI) to predict response to hyperventilation.
positive_variation: Three studies were conducted to compare the ability of a measure of appreciation of physical sensations (Anxiety Sensitivity Index; ASI) and a measure of trait anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory; STAI) to predict adaptive response to hyperventilation.
negative_variation: Three studies were conducted to compare the ability of a measure of fear of physical sensations (Anxiety Sensitivity Index; ASI) and a measure of trait anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory; STAI) to predict distressing response to hyperventilation.

baseline: In the first study subjects (N = 43) were selected who differed in scores on the ASI but were equated on levels of trait anxiety.

baseline: Women scoring in the borderline range at baseline were more likely to move into the normal than the clinically significant range for anxiety (2 = 40.36, p < 0.001) and also for depression (2 = 56.04, p < 0.001), and women scoring in the clinically significant range for anxiety were more likely to become normal than vice versa (2 = 5.95, p < 0.02).
positive_variation: Women scoring in the borderline range at baseline were more likely to move into the normal than the clinically significant range for anxiety (2 = 40.36, p < 0.001) and also for depression (2 = 56.04, p < 0.001), and women scoring in the clinically significant range for anxiety had better odds of becoming normal than vice versa (2 = 5.95, p < 0.02).
negative_variation: Women scoring in the borderline range at baseline were less likely to remain in the clinically significant than the normal range for anxiety (2 = 40.36, p < 0.001) and also for depression (2 = 56.04, p < 0.001), and women scoring in the clinically significant range for anxiety were more at risk of reverting to the anxious state than vice versa (2 = 5.95, p < 0.02).

baseline: Twenty-one patients with significant long-term therapeutic benzodiazepine (BZ) use, who remained abstinent at 6 months follow-up after successfully completing a standardized inpatient BZ withdrawal regime, and 21 normal controls matched for age and IQ but not for anxiety, were repeatedly tested on a simple battery of routine psychometric tests of cognitive function, pre- and post-withdrawal and at 6 months follow-up.
positive_variation: Twenty-one patients with significant long-term therapeutic benzodiazepine (BZ) use, who remained abstinent at 6 months follow-up after successfully completing a standardized inpatient BZ withdrawal regimen, and 21 normal controls matched for age and IQ but not for resilience during anxiety, were repeatedly tested on a simple battery of routine psychometric tests of cognitive function, pre- and post-withdrawal and at 6 months follow-up.

baseline: Analysis indicated significantly higher final examination performance for the distributed testing condition; a significant reduction in test anxiety between initial sessions and the remainder of the term in the distributed testing condition; no difference in test anxiety between the distributed testing and control conditions when test anxiety was assessed at the end of the term; and nonsignificant correlations between test anxiety dimensions of the Reactions to Tests and achievement in both the control and distributed testing conditions.
positive_variation: Analysis indicated significantly higher final examination performance for the distributed testing condition; a significant improvement in test anxiety between initial sessions and the remainder of the term in the distributed testing condition; no difference in test anxiety between the distributed testing and control conditions when test anxiety was assessed at the end of the term; and nonsignificant correlations between test anxiety dimensions of the Reactions to Tests and achievement in both the control and distributed testing conditions.
negative_variation: Analysis indicated significantly higher final examination performance for the distributed testing condition; a significant persistence of test anxiety between initial sessions and the remainder of the term in the distributed testing condition; no difference in test anxiety between the distributed testing and control conditions when test anxiety was assessed at the end of the term; and nonsignificant correlations between test anxiety dimensions of the Reactions to Tests and achievement in both the control and distributed testing conditions.

baseline: Analyses showed that there was a difference in mean State Anxiety scores between the two groups, with the control group having a lower mean than the experimental group, which was contrary to our expectation.

negative_variation: Analyses showed that there was a difference in mean State Anxiety scores between the two groups, with the control group having a significantly lower mean than the experimental group, which was alarmingly contrary to our expectation.
